intro: Dichaelia brachylepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dichaelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
